description: Elevator simulation configuration - adjust these parameters to tune the system behavior

strategy.description: Elevator assignment scoring weights (lower score = better choice)
strategy.comment_distance: Multiplier for distance score. Higher = distance matters more
strategy.comment_full: Penalty points when elevator is full (can't pick up)
strategy.comment_same_direction: Bonus (negative) when elevator moving in same direction AND not too busy
strategy.comment_opposite_direction: Penalty when elevator moving opposite direction
strategy.comment_load_factor: Weight for current load (0-20 based on % full). Higher = prefer emptier elevators
strategy.comment_idle: Bonus for idle elevators (negative = prefer idle)

traffic.comment_base: People per minute during normal hours (increased for stress test)
traffic.comment_visitors: If true, mall visitors enter at floor 1, visit 20-120 mins, return to floor 1

simulation.comment_control: How often elevator controller checks state (milliseconds)
simulation.comment_traffic: How often to check if new people should be generated (seconds)
simulation.comment_movement: Delay factor for floor-to-floor movement (seconds / speed)
simulation.comment_stats: How often to record statistics snapshot (seconds)

behavior.comment_direction: If true, elevator can change direction when it has no passengers
behavior.comment_nearest: If true, strongly prefer closest requests (current behavior)
behavior.comment_reassign: If person waits longer than this, consider reassigning elevator (not implemented yet)
behavior.comment_load_balance: Consider load factor when selecting elevators

advanced_strategies.description: Advanced features you might want to implement
advanced_strategies.comment_destination: Future: Assign elevator when person enters destination (like modern buildings)
advanced_strategies.comment_zoning: Future: Dedicate elevators to specific floor ranges
advanced_strategies.comment_predictive: Future: Position idle elevators based on predicted demand
advanced_strategies.comment_energy: Future: Consider energy consumption in scoring (favor less movement)
